etymologies: Old English dēor, also originally denoting any quadruped, used in the (now archaic) phrase small deer meaning ‘small creatures collectively’; of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dier, German Tier

crossReferenceMarkers: See also mouse deer, musk deer
definitions: a hoofed grazing or browsing animal, with branched bony antlers that are shed annually and typically borne only by the male.

notes.text: Family Cervidae: several genera and many species

shortDefinitions: hoofed grazing or browsing animal, with branched bony antlers that are shed annually
